item.title: PhD Student Research Abroad: Fulbright Information Session Feb. 4th at Noon
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 4, 2026 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - PhD students interested in collaborating with faculty at foreign universities may complete their dissertation research abroad. To travel fall of 2027, join the virtual information session this February 4th at noon. U.S. citizenship required. Register for the Fulbright Information session: https://surveys.rpi.edu/jfe/form/SV_6L3FFwv0qCROrvE Questions: email madige@rpi.edu

item.title: OGE Dissertation and Thesis Preparation Workshop | Feb. 3
item.description: Date: Tuesday, February 3, 2026 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Learn the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles—plus a review of the most commonly found mistakes and ways to avoid them. This workshop is for any student who will be writing a MS thesis or PhD dissertation. Bring your questions! To register for this WebEx event: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdLuGBkzQiXASkdKXbBKD_x4KXbpC2dGgLh6ZIDr1Qs4-Pbvw/viewform?usp=header

item.title: Congratulations to Professor Douglas Swank
item.description: Professor Douglas Swank has been selected to receive the Marion J. Siegman Annual Award Lectureship from the American Physiological Society! Dr. Swank’s work has helped advance how we understand how muscles function, contributing important insights that support future discoveries in health and medicine. As part of this recognition, he has been invited to present an award lecture at the American Physiology Summit, taking place April 23-26 in Minneapolis. This well-deserved recognition reflects…

item.title: Webinar on Friday January 30: RPI Digital Asset Management (DAM) System
item.description: Join Jim Evans, Director of MultiMedia Services, on Friday January 30 from 11am to 12pm, for a live webinar introducing Rensselaer’s Digital Asset Management System. Discover how to access campus‑wide photography, multimedia files, and institutional assets—all in one place. Register now: https://rensselaer.webex.com/webappng/sites/rensselaer/webinar/webinarSeries/register/783d951c6ab8482e9198a7bd6075a700

item.title: Coming Soon – Blackboard Learn Ultra Course View
item.description: Blackboard has announced an end-of-life for Original course view, the course view we currently use. Therefore, RPI will be moving to Blackboard Learn Ultra Course View beginning with the summer 2026 semester. Details on the training and support available to help you get the most out of Blackboard Learn Ultra’s tools and features are coming soon. Please watch MorningMail over the next few months for more information.
